page.p: Notification can be used in subscriptions or for delayed repsonse

Template fields
Check official qweb documentation: https://www.odoo.com/documentation/8.0/reference/qweb.html

p.pre:
Vars that can be updated: * data - empty dictonary to be filled with any data for rendering * options - dictonary to control processing * options['notify_user_ids'] - list interger user ids to be notified in subscription commands (will affect only if user is subscribed). With empty list nobody receives notification. With unspecified value all subscribers receive notification. * options['reply_markup'] * options['charts'] (module telegram_chart is required) - empty list to be filled by pygal chart objects * options['photos'] - empty list of dictionaries with keys * data * type = "file"|"base64". Default is "base64". * filename
Vars that can be used: * command - telegram.command record * command.encode_callback_data(data) - prepare data to attach to InlineKeyboardButton. See https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinekeyboardbutton * tsession - telegram.session record. * tsession.user_id - current user * tmessage - message from telegram. See https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message * tmessage.text - actual UTF-8 text of the message * callback_query - see https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#callbackquery * callback_data - decoded data, that was created via command.encode_callback_data and passed to types.Inlinekeyboardbutton * event - dictonary with keys 'active_model', 'active_id', 'active_ids'. Only for commands triggered by base.action.rule. * env - odoo Environment * _logger - logger * _ - translate tool
Libs that can be used: * datetime * dateutil * time * tools (openerp.tools) * pygal (module telegram_chart is required) * types - telebot.types . See https://github.com/eternnoir/pyTelegramBotAPI/blob/master/telebot/types.py and https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#available-types * types.InlineKeyboardMarkup * types.InlineKeyboardButton * emoji - see https://pypi.python.org/pypi/emoji * emoji.emojize(':thumbsup:', use_aliases=True) - convert alias to emoji unicode. See http://www.webpagefx.com/tools/emoji-cheat-sheet/
